articles.title: Fed governor Lisa Cook called condo a second home, documents show - The Washington Post
articles.description: The documents, first reported by Reuters on Friday evening, come as Trump is pushing to fire Cook over unproven allegations of mortgage fraud.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI lays off hundreds of data annotators - Business Insider
articles.description: XAI laid off at least 500 of the workers on its data annotation team on Friday night.

articles.title: Trump Files to Cancel Approval of Maryland Offshore Wind Farm - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: The Trump administration asked a federal court to cancel the approval of a $6 billion wind project planned off the coast of Maryland as part of a wider effort to halt the development of the offshore clean- energy resource.

articles.title: Lutnick says Musk was ‘backward’ in cutting government - The Washington Post
articles.description: The commerce secretary said the billionaire’s efforts focused too much on reducing the workforce rather than targeting waste.

articles.title: Boeing’s (BA) Striking Defense Workers Reject Latest Contract Offer - TipRanks
articles.description: The workers turned down a 45% wage increase.

articles.title: Moderna Falls as Trump Officials Tie Child Deaths to Covid Shots - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Vaccine makers’ shares fell after a report that Trump health officials plan to link Covid shots to the deaths of around two dozen children in a presentation to advisers to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention next week.

articles.title: Black Rock Coffee Bar, founded in Oregon, worth more than $1 billion after IPO - OregonLive.com
articles.description: Like Dutch Bros, Black Rock moved its headquarters to Arizona.

articles.title: Tim Cook addresses iPhone Air battery life in new interview at Corning factory - 9to5Mac
articles.description: Tim Cook visited Corning’s factory in Kentucky, where he spoke with CNBC’s Jim Cramer about the company’s recent product announcements.

articles.title: Bank of America chief Brian Moynihan shakes up leadership team - Financial Times
articles.description: Overhaul comes as lender hones list of candidates to replace longtime leader in the future

articles.title: Via shrugs off tepid open to end first day of trading slightly above IPO price - TechCrunch
articles.description: Transit tech software startup Via had its IPO debut on Friday, starting at below offering price before rising to close at nearly $50.

articles.title: Massachusetts sues Kalshi alleging illegal sports gambling - CNBC
articles.description: Massachusetts argues Kalshi is making more money on sports wagers than legal, licensed sportsbooks.

articles.title: Stellantis cancels Ram 1500 REV as electric truck demand dims - The Verge
articles.description: Stellantis is axing its Ram 1500 REV electric truck, citing decreasing demand for heavy duty trucks.

articles.description: The Gemini crypto exchange sold fewer-than-expected shares.

articles.title: Why the Oracle-OpenAI deal caught Wall Street by surprise - TechCrunch
articles.description: The $300B deal is a reminder that despite Oracle’s legacy status, it shouldn’t be overlooked when it comes to AI infrastructure. But key questions around power and how OpenAI will pay for this remain.

articles.title: Ray Dalio calls for wealth ‘redistribution policy’ when AI and humanoid robots start to benefit the 1% to 10% more than everyone else - Fortune
articles.description: The hedge fund billionaire sees a "limited number of winners and a bunch of losers" with the 1% to 10% "benefiting a lot."
